title: Basic Sanitation Information System - BaSIS
text: primary goal BaSIS (Basic Sanitation Information System) within context implementing Community-Led Total Sanitation (CLTS) Ghana combat open defecation. collecting data communities practicing open defecation, project aims shift away previous subsidy-based approaches focus community engagement. BaSIS seeks empower communities, particularly regions like Upper West, Eastern, Northern, Volta, Central, abandon open defecation practices CLTS. objective break cycle fecal-oral contamination, reduce spread diseases linked poor sanitation, promote sustainable, community-driven solutions improve overall hygiene sanitation practices.

what: 1) Extracting the Top 10 Districts with the Highest Percentage of ODF Communities in Ghana
title: Basic Sanitation Information System - BaSIS
text: following code demonstrates calculate percentage ODF communities per region Ghana. computation involves using ODF population data sourced basisghana dataset, conjunction total population statistics categorized region, sourced ghanapop dataset.
code: library(tidyverse) library(basisghana) library(dplyr)   odf_by_district <- basisghana |>    group_by(district_en) |>    summarize(odf_population = sum(population, na.rm = TRUE))   odf_by_district <- merge(odf_by_district, ghanapop, by = 'district_en', all = TRUE) |>    mutate(percentage = round(odf_population / total_pop * 100, 2)) |>    arrange(desc(percentage))     top_10_odf <- odf_by_district |>    top_n(10, percentage) |>    select(district_en, region_en, percentage) |>   mutate(percentage = paste0(percentage, "%")) |>    rename(     district = "district_en",     region = "region_en",     `proportion ODF population in district` = "percentage"   )  top_10_odf #>                 district        region proportion ODF population in district #> 1         Tatale Sanguli      Northern                                39.55% #> 2                   Mion      Northern                                28.32% #> 3              Chereponi Northern East                                25.87% #> 4                Wa West    Upper West                                25.68% #> 5   Daffiama Bussie Issa    Upper West                                24.93% #> 6                   Garu    Upper East                                22.96% #> 7                Zabzugu      Northern                                20.82% #> 8  Bunkpurugu Nakpanduri Northern East                                20.79% #> 9       Sawla-Tuna-Kalba      Savannah                                19.62% #> 10               Binduri    Upper East                                18.86%

what: 2) Mapping the Regions with highest percentage of ODF communities in Ghana
title: Basic Sanitation Information System - BaSIS
text: code uses dataset ODF communities categorized districts (see ), aggregated based regions Ghana. ’s important note reference Ghana’s regions pertains former 10 regions preceding 2018 referendum, subsequently led establishment new regions, resulting total 16 regions 2020 (Refer Regions Ghana). collected data across 5 former regions, color-coded map Ghana depicts varying proportions Open Defecation Free (ODF) communities region.  Note: logarithmic scale employed accentuate distinctions among lower percentage values.
code: library(sf) library(rnaturalearth) library(ggplot2)  #group the regions according to how they were back in 2017 (10 regions instead of 16) odf_by_region <- odf_by_district |>    mutate(region_en = case_when(     region_en %in% c("Bono", "Bono East", "Ahafo") ~ "Brong Ahafo",     region_en %in% c("Northern", "Savannah", "Northern East") ~ "Northern",     region_en %in% c("Volta", "Oti") ~ "Volta",     region_en %in% c("Western", "Western North") ~ "Western",     TRUE ~ as.character(region_en)   )) |>    group_by(region_en) |>       summarize(     odf_population = sum(odf_population, na.rm = TRUE),     female = sum(female_pop, na.rm = TRUE),       male = sum(male_pop, na.rm = TRUE),      total_pop = sum(total_pop, na.rm = TRUE)   ) |>    mutate(percentage = round(odf_population / total_pop * 100, 2)) |>    arrange(desc(percentage)) |>    filter(!is.na(region_en)) |>    select(region_en, percentage)  ghana <- ne_states(country = "Ghana", returnclass = "sf") |>    rename(     region_en = "name"   )  ggplot() +   theme_void() +   geom_sf(data = full_join(ghana, odf_by_region, by = "region_en"), aes(fill = percentage), color = "white", lwd = 0) +   scale_fill_gradientn(name = paste("Percentage of ODF population", "\n by region (logarithmic scale)"),                        trans = "log",                        labels = scales::label_number(accuracy = 1),                        colors = c("#2E8B57","#9DBF9E", "#FCB97D", "#A84268"),                        na.value = "grey80") +   labs(title = paste("Regions with highest percentage of ODF communities", "\n                              in Ghana (2017)")) +   theme_minimal() +    theme(     plot.title = element_text(size = 14),       plot.margin = margin(1, 1, 1, 1, "cm")     )

Basic Sanitation Information System - BaSIS — basisghana
text: tibble 1618 rows 10 variables: running id unique region. region First level subnational government administration within Republic Ghana. district Second level administrative subdivision region. area_council Third level administrative unit district level. community Open defecation free (ODF) community. community smallest level local administration Ghana (also called unit committees). partner Implementing partner CLTS (Community-Led Total Sanitation) program respective community. population Population size respective community. households Number households respective community. toilets Number toilets respective community. hwf Number handwashing facilities respective community.

title: Ghana Population — ghanapop
text: dataset contains demographic details district Ghana, including population breakdown gender total population counts. offers insights regional demographics gender distribution across Ghana's districts.

title: Ghana Population — ghanapop
text: tibble 260 rows 9 variables: country_en English name denoting country data gathered (Ghana). country_pcode ISO2 code representing Ghana (country data collection). region_en English designation specifying region within Ghana. (Ghana comprises 16 distinct regions.) region_pcode postal code linked specific region. district_en English name identifying district Ghana. (261 districts Ghana.) district_pcode postal code specific district. female_pop Total female population within corresponding District. male_pop Total male population within corresponding District. total_pop Total population within corresponding District.
